taskDescription:
Mercury is about <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>3.114</mn>
  <mo>×<!-- × --></mo>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msup>
      <mn>10</mn>
      <mn>7</mn>
    </msup>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">3.114 \times {10^7}</annotation></semantics></math> miles from the sun. Neptune is about <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>2.781</mn>
  <mo>×<!-- × --></mo>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msup>
      <mn>10</mn>
      <mn>9</mn>
    </msup>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">2.781 \times {10^9}</annotation></semantics></math> miles from the sun. How many times further is Neptune from the sun than Mercury?
detailedSolution:
Neptune is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>8.930</mn>
  <mo>×<!-- × --></mo>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msup>
      <mn>10</mn>
      <mn>1</mn>
    </msup>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">8.930 \times {10^1}</annotation></semantics></math>, or 89.3, times further from the sun that Mercury.
